people.name: David Sotomayor-Ramírez, Ph.D.
people.description: Doctor David Sotomayor obtained his undergraduate degree in Chemistry and masters in Oceanographic Chemistry, both from the University of Puerto Rico at Mayagüez (UPRM). In 1996, Dr. Sotomayor obtained his doctoral degree at Kansas State University in Agronomy and Soils, studying under the direction of Dr. Charles Rice. Currently, he is a professor under the Agricultural Sciences Faculty of UPRM. Dr. Sotomayor offers Soil Fertility undergraduate and graduate courses. Among his research projects, some of the investigation areas that stand out are related to nutrient management, fertility and soil quality, soil microbiology, water quality and management of hydrographic basins. He has published over 60 peer reviewed articles and has presented in multiple professional and scientific congresses.
